metadata.title: CVE-2021-42771 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Babel.Locale in Babel before 2.9.1 allows attackers to load arbitrarylocale .dat files (containing serialized Python objects) via directorytraversal, leading to code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42771` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-babel - 1.3+dfsg.1-2ubuntu2+esm1
python-babel-localedata - 1.3+dfsg.1-2ubuntu2+esm1
python-pybabel - 1.3+dfsg.1-2ubuntu2+esm1
python3-babel - 1.3+dfsg.1-2ubuntu2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-babel package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3+dfsg.1-2ubuntu2+esm1').
